discussions.title: How do I improve my quiz scores?
discussions.content: I recommend doing daily mini quizzes and reviewing missed answers!

python.title: Python Programming
python.description: Master the fundamentals of Python â€” from syntax and loops to OOP, algorithms, and debugging. Designed for those preparing for the TOPCIT exam software domain.

lessons.title: Lesson 1: Introduction to Python
lessons.content: Python is an interpreted, high-level, general-purpose programming language known for its readability and simplicity. It is widely used in automation, web development, data science, and AI.

questions.text: What is Python primarily known for?
options: Its complex syntax and long lines of code
Being only used for web development
questions.hint: Think about why Python is often recommended for beginners.

questions.text: Which of the following is a valid comment in Python?
questions.hint: Look for the symbol Python uses to start single-line comments.

questions.text: Which function is used to get user input in Python?
questions.hint: This function waits for the user to type something into the console.

questions.text: Which of these fields benefit most from Python?
questions.hint: Pythonâ€™s pandas and NumPy are dominant in this domain.

lessons.title: Lesson 2: Variables and Data Types
lessons.content: Python supports several data types such as int, float, str, list, tuple, dict, and bool. Variables do not require explicit type declarations.

questions.text: Write the correct syntax to assign the value 5 to a variable named x.
questions.hint: Use the assignment operator =.

questions.text: What is the output of: print(type([1,2,3]))
questions.hint: The square brackets [] define this type.

questions.text: Which of the following is immutable?
questions.hint: One of these cannot be changed after creation.

questions.text: What will be the type of variable x after: x = '10'?
questions.hint: Anything enclosed in quotes is considered this type.

questions.text: Convert a string '25' into an integer in Python.
questions.hint: Use the casting function for integers.

lessons.title: Lesson 3: Control Flow and Loops
lessons.content: Control flow statements like if, for, and while determine how the program executes under different conditions.

questions.text: Which keyword is used for an alternative condition if the first one fails?
questions.hint: It combines 'else' and 'if' in a single word.

questions.text:
What will be the output of the following code?

x = 0
while x < 3:
    x += 1
print(x)
questions.hint: How many times will the loop increase x before failing the condition?

questions.text: Write a Python loop that prints numbers from 1 to 5.
questions.hint: Use range() and a for loop.

questions.text: Which loop is guaranteed to execute at least once?
questions.hint: Python does not have one of these loop types directly.

htmlcss.title: HTML & CSS Fundamentals
htmlcss.description: Learn to build and style responsive web pages â€” essential for TOPCIT web technology and software implementation topics.

lessons.title: Lesson 1: HTML Basics
lessons.content: HTML defines the structure of web pages using elements and tags. It uses attributes to describe properties of elements.

questions.text: What does HTML stand for?
questions.hint: Itâ€™s the standard language for creating web pages.

questions.text: Which tag is used to create a hyperlink?
questions.hint: It stands for 'anchor'.

questions.text: Write the correct HTML tag to display an image named 'logo.png'.
questions.hint: Remember to include both src and alt attributes.

questions.text: Which tag defines the largest heading in HTML?
questions.hint: Headings range from <h1> to <h6>.

questions.text: Which attribute is used to open a link in a new tab?
questions.hint: It targets a new browser tab.

lessons.title: Lesson 2: CSS Fundamentals
lessons.content: CSS adds design and layout control to HTML. It supports selectors, classes, IDs, and properties.

questions.text: Which property changes the text color in CSS?
questions.hint: It directly controls text color.

questions.text: Write the CSS rule to center-align all text in a div element.
questions.hint: Use text-align property.

questions.text: Which CSS selector targets all paragraph elements?
questions.hint: Tag selectors target elements by their name.

questions.text: Which unit in CSS is relative to the parent element's font size?
questions.hint: It scales based on the parentâ€™s font size.

questions.text: Which CSS property adds space inside an elementâ€™s border?
questions.hint: Itâ€™s the inner spacing.

sql.title: SQL for Beginners
sql.description: Understand relational databases and master querying using SQL. Includes data retrieval, joins, and optimization â€” aligned with TOPCIT database concepts.

lessons.title: Lesson 1: Introduction to SQL
lessons.content: SQL stands for Structured Query Language. It is used to store, retrieve, and manage data in relational databases.

questions.text: Which SQL statement retrieves data from a database?
questions.hint: This command specifies which columns to view from a table.

questions.text: Write an SQL query to display all columns from a table named employees.
questions.hint: Use * to select every column.

questions.text: Which clause specifies the source table in an SQL query?
questions.hint: It tells SQL which table to read data from.

questions.text: Which database object stores data in rows and columns?
questions.hint: Itâ€™s the core structure where records are kept.

lessons.title: Lesson 2: Data Filtering and Sorting
lessons.content: The WHERE clause filters results, and ORDER BY sorts them ascending or descending.

questions.text: Which SQL clause filters results based on conditions?
questions.hint: Used to apply logical conditions like =, >, <.

questions.text: Write a query to select names from 'students' table sorted by age descending.
questions.answer: SELECT name FROM students ORDER BY age DESC;
questions.hint: Add ORDER BY followed by DESC for descending order.

questions.text: Which SQL keyword is used to eliminate duplicate rows?
questions.hint: It ensures each value appears only once in the result set.

questions.text: Which operator checks if a value matches a pattern?
questions.hint: Often used with wildcards like % and _.

lessons.title: Lesson 3: Joins and Relationships
lessons.content: Joins combine records from multiple tables. Common joins include INNER JOIN, LEFT JOIN, and RIGHT JOIN.

questions.text: Which SQL join returns only the matching rows?
questions.hint: This join excludes unmatched rows from both tables.

questions.text: Write an SQL query joining 'students' and 'grades' on student_id.
questions.answer: SELECT * FROM students INNER JOIN grades ON students.id = grades.student_id;
questions.hint: Use INNER JOIN with an ON condition linking the keys.

questions.text: Which join returns all rows from the left table and matching ones from the right?
questions.hint: It keeps all records from the left table.

questions.text: Which clause is used to group rows with the same values?
questions.hint: Often paired with aggregate functions like COUNT or SUM.

java.title: Java Essentials
java.description: Master Java programming concepts â€” variables, methods, OOP, and exceptions. Essential for TOPCITâ€™s software implementation and debugging sections.

lessons.title: Lesson 1: Java Basics
lessons.content: Java is an object-oriented programming language. It is platform-independent because of the Java Virtual Machine (JVM).

questions.text: What makes Java platform-independent?
questions.hint: The Java Virtual Machine allows bytecode to run anywhere.

questions.text: Which method serves as the entry point of a Java program?
questions.hint: Every Java application begins with this method.

questions.text: Write a line to print 'Hello, Java!' in Java.
questions.hint: Use System.out.println() for console output.

questions.text: Which file extension is used for Java source code?
questions.hint: Itâ€™s the human-readable code before compilation.

questions.text: Which keyword defines a constant variable?
questions.hint: Used to prevent variable reassignment.

lessons.title: Lesson 2: Classes and Methods
lessons.content: Classes group fields and methods. Methods define behaviors that objects can perform.

questions.text: Write the syntax to declare a class named Student.
questions.hint: Use the 'class' keyword followed by the name.

questions.text: Which keyword is used to create an object in Java?
questions.hint: It allocates memory for the object.

questions.text: Which access modifier allows a method to be visible to all classes?
questions.hint: It provides the widest visibility scope.

questions.text: What is it called when a subclass defines a method already in its superclass?
questions.hint: Used to modify inherited behavior.

lessons.title: Lesson 3: Exception Handling and Debugging
lessons.content: Exception handling in Java prevents program crashes using try, catch, and finally blocks.

questions.text: Which keyword handles exceptions in Java?
questions.hint: It captures exceptions raised inside try blocks.

questions.text: Write the Java syntax for a try-catch block that handles generic exceptions.
questions.hint: Wrap risky code inside try, and handle errors in catch.

questions.text: Which of the following is a checked exception?
questions.hint: Checked exceptions must be declared in method signatures.

questions.text: Which block executes regardless of whether an exception occurs?
questions.hint: It runs cleanup code like closing files.

javascript.title: JavaScript Advanced
javascript.description: Deepen your understanding of modern JavaScript concepts â€” including ES6+, asynchronous programming, and DOM manipulation for dynamic web apps.

lessons.title: Lesson 1: ES6 and Modern Syntax
lessons.content: ES6 introduced features like let/const, arrow functions, template literals, and destructuring for cleaner code.

questions.text: Which keyword creates a block-scoped variable in ES6?
questions.hint: It behaves like var but respects block scope.

questions.text: Write an arrow function that returns the square of a number x.
questions.hint: Use the arrow function syntax without 'function'.

questions.text: Which ES6 feature allows unpacking values from arrays or objects?
questions.hint: It uses curly or square brackets to extract values.

questions.text: What does the 'const' keyword do?
questions.hint: You canâ€™t reassign the variable, but its content can change if itâ€™s an object.

lessons.title: Lesson 2: Asynchronous JavaScript
lessons.content: Asynchronous operations in JavaScript are handled with callbacks, promises, and async/await syntax.

questions.text: Which method is used to handle resolved or rejected promises?
questions.hint: Used to define actions after a promise resolves.

questions.text: Write a basic async function that logs 'Done'.
questions.hint: Use 'async' before the function keyword.

questions.text: Which keyword pauses execution until a promise resolves?
questions.hint: It can only be used inside async functions.

questions.text: Which pattern prevents 'callback hell'?
questions.hint: This feature replaced old callback chains.

react.title: React Framework
react.description: Build dynamic and reusable UI components with React. Learn state management, hooks, and virtual DOM concepts.

lessons.title: Lesson 1: Components and JSX
lessons.content: React components can be function-based or class-based. JSX allows writing HTML inside JavaScript.

questions.text: What does JSX stand for?
questions.hint: It lets you write HTML-like syntax inside JS.

questions.text: Write a simple React function component named 'Hello'.
questions.hint: A function returning JSX defines a component.

questions.text: What must be imported to use JSX?
questions.hint: JSX is compiled via the React library.

questions.text: Each React component must return:
questions.hint: Components describe UI via JSX.

questions.text: What is the purpose of the virtual DOM?
questions.hint: React uses it to efficiently update only changed parts.

lessons.title: Lesson 2: State and Props
lessons.content: Props pass data from parent to child components, while state manages internal component data.

questions.text: Props in React are:
questions.hint: They canâ€™t be modified by child components.

questions.text: How do you initialize state in a functional component?
questions.hint: React Hook that defines reactive variables.

questions.text: Which hook is used for side effects like API calls?
questions.hint: This hook runs code after rendering.

questions.text: Which method updates component data in class-based components?
questions.hint: The most common way to modify component data in classes.

cpp.title: C++ Fundamentals
cpp.description: Learn the basics of C++ programming â€” variables, control structures, OOP, and memory management for efficient applications.

lessons.title: Lesson 1: Basics and Syntax
lessons.content: C++ uses a strong static type system and requires explicit variable declarations.

questions.text: Which symbol marks the end of a statement in C++?
questions.hint: It's the same symbol used in Java and C.

questions.text: Write the syntax for a basic C++ main function.
questions.hint: Start with int main() followed by braces.

questions.text: Which header file is needed for input and output?
questions.hint: It contains cout and cin.

questions.text: Which operator is used for insertion in output streams?
questions.hint: Used with cout for displaying output.

aiml.title: Intro to AI & Machine Learning
aiml.description: Understand the foundations of Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning â€” key algorithms, data preprocessing, and model evaluation concepts relevant to the TOPCIT software domain.

lessons.title: Lesson 1: Fundamentals of AI
lessons.content: Artificial Intelligence aims to create systems that can perform tasks that typically require human intelligence â€” such as reasoning, perception, and learning.

questions.text: Which of the following best defines Artificial Intelligence?
options: Software that automates simple tasks only
questions.hint: AI refers to systems designed to think and learn like humans.

questions.text: Which branch of AI focuses on enabling machines to learn from data?
questions.hint: Itâ€™s the core of modern AI systems.

questions.text: Name one real-world application of AI.
questions.answer: Examples include voice assistants, self-driving cars, or recommendation systems.
questions.hint: Think about where you see smart automation every day.

questions.text: Which of these is NOT a goal of AI?
questions.hint: AI focuses on automating and enhancing cognitive tasks.

lessons.title: Lesson 2: Machine Learning Basics
lessons.content: Machine Learning enables systems to automatically improve from experience without explicit programming. It is categorized into supervised, unsupervised, and reinforcement learning.

questions.text: Which type of learning uses labeled data?
questions.hint: Training involves input-output pairs.

questions.text: Which algorithm is commonly used for classification problems?
questions.hint: This algorithm splits data based on attribute values.

questions.text: What is the main goal of unsupervised learning?
questions.answer: To find patterns or structure in unlabeled data.
questions.hint: Itâ€™s used for clustering and association.

questions.text: Which of these is a reinforcement learning example?
questions.hint: This type of learning relies on rewards and penalties.

lessons.title: Lesson 3: Model Evaluation and Metrics
lessons.content: Evaluating ML models is crucial to ensure accuracy, fairness, and generalization. Common metrics include accuracy, precision, recall, and F1-score.

questions.text: Which metric measures the proportion of correctly classified instances?
questions.hint: Itâ€™s the simplest measure of overall correctness.

questions.text: Define precision in the context of ML evaluation.
questions.answer: Precision = True Positives / (True Positives + False Positives)
questions.hint: It focuses on how many predicted positives were correct.

questions.text: Which metric is most useful for imbalanced datasets?
questions.hint: It balances precision and recall.

questions.text: Which technique helps prevent overfitting?
questions.hint: It splits data into multiple training and testing sets.

git.title: Version Control with Git
git.description: Master Git commands, branching strategies, and version tracking for collaborative development.

lessons.title: Lesson 1: Git Basics
lessons.content: Git tracks file changes and enables version control in software development.

questions.text: Which command initializes a new Git repository?
questions.hint: Use this before your first commit.

questions.text: Write the command to stage all modified files.
questions.hint: Use the dot to include all files.

questions.text: Which command shows commit history?
questions.hint: Displays a chronological list of commits.

questions.text: Which command creates a new branch?
questions.hint: Used to manage feature or bug-fix branches.

api.title: RESTful API Design
api.description: Learn the principles of REST architecture and how to design scalable, secure APIs using HTTP methods and JSON data.

lessons.title: Lesson 1: REST Basics
lessons.content: REST stands for Representational State Transfer. It uses HTTP methods like GET, POST, PUT, and DELETE for CRUD operations.

questions.text: Which HTTP method retrieves data from a server?
questions.hint: It's the read operation in CRUD.

questions.text: Which format is most commonly used for REST responses?
questions.hint: Lightweight and easy to parse in JavaScript.

questions.text: What does 'idempotent' mean in REST?
options: Safe to repeat without side effects
questions.answer: Safe to repeat without side effects
questions.hint: Applies to methods like PUT and DELETE.

questions.text: Write the endpoint URL to get all users in a REST API.
questions.hint: Plural resource names are a best practice.
